title: Poor App, Drops WiFi, Ok Otherwise
text:
I’ve used two of these for about two years. Here are some thoughts:
-Setup is unreliable. I’ll get the thermostat connected to WiFi and it will never connect to the Lux server so I’ll just be stuck trying over and over before I finally get it working.
-WiFi signal drops and doesn’t reconnect. I’ve had to reconnect these things 5x a year and often just leave them disconnected from WiFi.
-The App is pure trash. You can’t reconnect a thermostat to WiFi from the app, need to create a whole new entry. The app lacks most common features one would expect in any modern app.

title: New app and changes makes this totally useless
text: I have two of these in a rental and I used to be able to lock the controls to only have temperature control. This is extremely important since I don’t want people to mess worth the settings. But they removed it for no reason with the new updated app. I noticed the feature was still available until I had to unlock the thermostats to change some settings and the app no longer had that option to do a level one lock. Why did they omit that feature when the thermostat still supports that feature??  Then after the updates, both thermostats will lose connection intermittently and frequently with the app simply stating there's a firmware update. The new app also makes changing the temperature the most difficult process ever. It's almost as if they don't know what a thermostats primary function is. You can't change the temperature past 10 degrees at a time and you have to confirm multiple times to either pause the schedule till a certain date and time or cancel it. It's so frustrating and I don't understand who designed this. No one wants to be asked this. The old app was so fluid and nice and just made sense. Bring back the old app! This is such a total piece of garbage in user design and functionality. Avoid their products of you have not bought it. Or return because clearly they don't know what they are doing. I'm so disappointed and I would return these if I could still.

title: Works fine for me
text:
I just bought a Lux Geo thermostat. After installing it, I had to download the app, and then went thru wifi network setup. At first it upgraded the thermostat’s software. Then I was able to use the app to check the current temperature and change the temperature setting. I really like that you can look at statistics of runtime and temperature for 24 hrs on each day. I haven't tried to schedule temperature setting yet. But so far I haven't observed any issues and overall I really like the app and the thermostat.

Update: I was able to setup a weekly schedule, it allows you to setup 4 events per day. I have already changed the schedule few times. I believe the thermostat connects to wifi only once per hour in order to extend battery life. So any time you make any changes to the schedule it wouldn't take an affect until the thermostat connects to wifi. I have seen so many complains about this app, but honestly I haven't had any issues with it and everything has worked okay so far.

title: This is the worst app I ever used
text:
Update - product support team (Mike) reached out to me via email and eventually touched base with me by phone to help resolve a lot of the issues I was having that helped address many of my criticisms. Since that time my experience with the interface has been much more positive so I am updating my rating from one star to four. 

I have never used an app less functional than this. This “ UPGRADE” to v2 made the app unreliable and unusable. The thermostats now spend >80% of the time off line; pushing of the schedule for a set amount of time never works, information (temperature or setting) related from the thermostat to the app are now unreliable. It is incredibly frustrating that thermostats that we bought and used at our vacation home are now impossible to really use remotely. It used to be that I could trust to change the temperature remotely and come to a warm house in winter - now this fail to work most of the time. I have tried resetting the thermostats, reconnected the thermostat to the app but nothing helps.

title: The Geo Lux was easy to set up. The app some potential with improvements but navigates great.
text: So far it seems to be all good. The thermostats, I ordered two, from mass save, were ten bucks a piece, so why not give it a shot. These were my first WiFi thermos. The set up was incredibly easy and fast. Now onto this App. I like the Lux app because it is really easy to navigate and I love the stats that are really useful when fine tuning your temperature sweet spots. I would like to see improvement in stats where I can look at month vs the same month last year and the potential dollars saved based on your providers rate. For those that are complaining about short batteries life, there are three settings with in the app for adjusting the responsiveness of communication between the app and the thermostat. It will increase or decrease the frequency in which the device communicate via the network. These modes will determine how long your batteries lasts. Play around with it and let us know. Mine are too new to know just yet.

title: I agree, PURE JUNK
text:
After hiring an electrician to install the Kono thermostat, because it needs a power source. I connected to the Lux app for about a month then without warning the app informed me that the thermostat was no longer connected to the internet. After numerous attempts at reconnecting the piece of junk I have given up. At least it controls the temperature even if I have to manually turn the dial every morning and every night. It was supposed to do that by itself. So much for it being a SMART thermostat. Oh and the app is still telling me everyday that it has set the away temperature, which it clearly has not. The same goes for every night when I come home. 
The Lux app I downloaded is garbage too. Sure I can see the temperature and the weather, but can’t switch the thing from heating mode to AC mode remotely. Why? Yesterday the high was 62 so naturally the heat had been on for a few days. Today the temperature is going to be 82! My wife would like me to change the thermostat to AC. Since I’m not home I figured the Lux app could do that. Boy was I wrong. 

I would trash it if it wasn’t for the fact I would have to buy another brand since I already threw away the old one.

title: App update made product useless
text: This used to work well, the geofencing feature made it so that when I was a mile from my house, it would turn the heat down automatically, and then turn it back on when I got within that zone. It shows that feature on the app and shows your adjustable zone, however that feature (called “Home and Away Aware”) simply does not work. It’s just a tease. You can manually set it to away, but what good is that? Why even show or claim it had a geofencing feature if the only way to set it is to go into the app and manually toggle the switch? I used to be able to remotely change the temperature via the app before leaving work for home, however every time I try to change the temperature when the schedule is on, a pop up interrupts at *every single degree change* asking if I want to “pause schedule”, whatever that means. This was a good product, but rendered useless by an awful app “update”. I do not recommend buying this produce, and actually think Apple should remove it from its store due to the completely misleading features that Johnson Controls, d/b/a Lux, claims it has.

title: Update: Much improved
text:
This latest version of the app has been greatly improved. Connection seems stable, interface is simpler and easier to use, and battery life lasts longer

Prior review:
Not sure what the developers were thinking with this release. At first install, thought it would improve the WiFi connection. Soon after discovered even with brand new lithium batteries installed, it now drops the connection more often than the prior version! It just does not work. Not only that, this version is much more difficult to set up with WiFi and the app. And the interface is worse: vertical line charts for temperature and heat settings? And the visual interface for setting the temperature is just stupid: multiple slides to set the temperature? Who thought these designs was a good idea? It’s not and is in fact a horrible user interface. To the developers: did you even test this app? You need to redo it. Period.

title: Muli-zone
text: I find many of the negative reviews interesting, because many of the things they complain about are accomplished by the app - you can still lock the thermostat if a rental house, toggle between heat and cool (or leave on auto), adjust the temp remotely, etc.  If I have complaint, as illustrated by the apparent confusion about what the app can do, it’s that Lux does not do a better job explaining where to find/how to adjust several of the settings - particularly when it comes to locking the thermostat and adjusting notifications (such as for low temp).  A customer should not have to spend an hour hunting for how to do something, as we are likely to throw our hands up in frustration and conclude we should have bought another thermostat (but on balance I love my Konos, particularly given cost savings compared to the competition).

title: Geo Thermostat
text: Overall the thermostat works great if using/changing anything manually and even the geofencing work great however this was prior to the WFH/pandemic so now with all the updates I don't know how well this aspect works now because I rarely leave my home.  My big issue is that this thermostat claimed to be Alexa capable yet I can never get it to work.  Alexa never recognizes the thermostat, which is terribly frustrating .  I have also tried connecting the thermostat to Apple HomeKit to see if it worked better than  Alexa but I can't even get HoneKit to recognize the thermostat.  So now I am forced  to find my  phone or walk over to the thermostat to make any changes- which totally defeats the purpose of spending money on a higher priced smart assistant enabled device.  Not to mention the latest update to the app made making any temperature changes a lot more confusing.  It was so easy before.  Needless to say, I'm a bit annoyed.

title: Worst app update ever
text: The new upgraded app is a downgrade. First, there was no warning, as the app just stopped working and forced an update to be installed. Then, it wasted our time since we had to reconnect it to the thermostat, and all of our schedules were gone. When I try to use the new wheel to change the temperature a degree or two, it only sometimes decides to work. So I have to try about 5 times before it finally changes the set temperature. The UI is not intuitive, so I find myself clicking all over the screen to try to find where to change settings. The thermostat drops wifi connection every so often now, when it never used to have trouble before (I see others say they have the same issue). And in my entire life, I have never seen a graph of temp vs time where time is on the y-axis. Never. Terrible design, not intuitive, and has software bugs. Three strikes.  I wish I could give it zero stars. Please bring back the old version!!!!! P.S. the app update in early Dec 2020 didn’t fix these issues.

title: Bring back the old app
text:
Ever since the update that made it appear more modern, this app has simply not worked properly. I have reset the physical thermostat and re-downloaded the app multiple times. The interface is not user friendly since the update. It takes too many confirmations and button presses for simple changes. I was recently out of town, with the house set at 55F. About 8 hours before returning home, I set it to begin warming to 68F. When I arrive home in the middle of the night it is still 55, even though the app shows I saved and ran the warmer program. It’s 3F here so that was a nice surprise. In the morning I wake up, the app shows it should be 68, but the thermostat has reverted to the previous 55, despite not having it on pause or away mode.

At this point I’m worried about pipes freezing due to the unreliability of this app. Save your money by not purchasing this piece of garbage. If they would’ve stayed with the original app prior to the 2020 update I would be giving 5 stars.

title: hate the new app and interface
text:
Worst purchase ever. But we have no clue wire and at the tile, had few options. Despite a huge battery drain, and periodic losing WiFi connection, the prior app and interface were intuitive and easy to use.  This new version is a mess. Programming disappears, holds spontaneously resumes heating. Brand new lithium batteries lasted a week. It’s a disaster. I purchased these to control heat in my mountain condo. I can’t be there to keep the temperatures stable and keep my unit from freezing. I need a reliable and intuitive thermostat.  This isn’t it. 

I don’t understand why these units have such horrible battery drains either. A lithium battery designed to last for ten years, lasts about four months. If you are very lucky. 

The documentation online is very spotty. Had to call abs wait a very long time to learn how to reconnect to the WiFi. And again when trying to place the unit on a constant hood status. Once you get a C SR on the phone, most of them are pretty helpful. But it’s a long process.

title: Can no longer connect to WiFi
text: I used to be able to go through the app and easily connect my Lux GEO to my wifi. Now, the app only gets me to Step 1 (go to setting and select the TSTAT SSID). After doing that, the both the app and the unit instructions are to return to the app. When I do…nothing happens.  I’ve tried this several times, trying both the app-assisted approach and without the app, all to no avail. What used to be straightforward and simple is now a mind-bogglingly frustrating waste of time and effort.  I can still set a schedule manually, but then what’s the point of having a wifi enabled tstat??  The problem is that without getting an electrician out to completely rewire my 2-wire heating system to get a really good tstat, I’m stuck with this one. I used to love it, but whatever changes were made to the app over the years have rendered it almost useless.

title: Bring back the old App
text:
I hope you are reading all these reviews and ditch the new app ASAP.
I bought 3 Lux thermostats a few months ago for a new home without a C wire already in place. The old app didn’t look fancy but was fully functional in every way. I could easily check the full status and set points of all my zones right from the Home Screen, see the date and time of last communication was super easily, setting the temp was completely straight forward, and schedules worked flawlessly. 
Now with this new app it shows zones offline all the time when they aren’t, there’s no way to know when the last time data was updated, simply setting the temp is super annoying and inconsistent, schedules don’t seem to save, and you have to click a lot more to find settings. 
Ditch this pretty looking app, and bring back the rock solid simple one.

title: New app has serious bug
text: I've had two Lux Geo's and love them however the original app was barebones but worked well. About a month ago I could not log into the app for almost two days so deleted it and tried to reinstall it. Had no idea they had updated this app. Overall the new app is a minor improvement but often when I change the temperature for one of my thermostats it does not remember the new setting. I go back into the app a few minutes later and see that the change did not take affect and have to change the temp again. Very annoying that one of the key functions is bugged. I have zero hope it will ever be fixed. Wish I could go back to the original app since it was very reliable.

title: Don’t waste you money
text: I purchased this thermostat back in 2016 and a year later it’s not connecting to WiFi which means the batteries are draining like crazy. How crazy you asked? I purchased an eight pack of batteries Saturday and I’ve used all of them already. Today is Monday by the way. Since the batteries are draining I’m waking up to a cold 60 degrees house when it’s 20 degrees outside. Oh what a joy. I called customer service since the thermostat say to call them and they said they’ll send out an outlet so it can work without batteries and once you receive it call back in and we can see what we can do about the WiFi. Who wants a WiFi thermostat that’s not connecting to the WiFi? They called back and told me I need to take the thermostat off the wall to give them come codes on a sticker before they can send the outlet. Sure, I’ll be taking it off the wall to throw it in the trash. What a waste of money. Buyers beware.

title: Bring back the old app
text: I don’t know who thought this was an improvement over the old app. This is incredibly difficult to figure out. The old app was easy and very clear.  Now, you have to do multiple settings in order to achieve the same thing that you achieved within a minute on the old app. This is unacceptable. The old thermostat app was simple but worked great; why it had to be ruined with this new app is beyond me. It is neither intuitive nor useful.  I was planning on buying another Lux  thermostat for my other property because I liked the simplicity and ease of use.  Now, not only will I not be buying another thermostat from Lux, but I will have to replace the current thermostat that I have with another brand, like Nest – unless they get this problem fixed in the next couple weeks before winter really hits here.

title: Latest update fixes interface for Geo users
text: Lux updated the app finally and it seems to have resolved two issues. First there is a Classic interface for Geo users that is much closer to the old interface just more “nice” looking. Second, the bug causing you to have to log in every time you launch the app seems to have been resolved. Big improvement. Rating changed from 2 to 4 stars. old review-The new interface looks nicer but it much harder to use and has either omitted or moved features. on top of that, it constantly logs me out each time i use the app. i honestly wish the old app was still available.

title: Piece of junk
text: The thermostat started to drain battery like crazy as stated by other users. I called and did as the customer service instructed and use the lithium battery as suggested by the manufacturer. It still drained and they had no choice but sent me the replacement unit since it was still under warranty. The new one worked for only few weeks and same craps happened again. Battery drained and would not connect to wifi no matter how many reset I did. I just turned of the wifi function and use it as a dumb thermostat. The app is even worse. Setup was a pain and you can not reconnect without adding a nice device. So even now I got notifications for the first and second units not online. This company is a joke and the whole setup is a joke too. Waste of money as many have commented. I wish I could give it zero star.

title: HATE new app — bring back old one!
text:
I’ve had used the Lux app for over five years to control a total of four thermostats. The old app was so easy to use. The new one seems like it was designed to be as non-intuitive as possible. Everything is too hard. Particularly annoying: Can’t figure out how to change “away” temperatures or how to get rid of the “replace filter” messages when they have been replaced. 

Its functioning seems to have improved slightly in the last month or so: It no longer constantly claims one or both of our thermostats can’t connect to wifi. (We didn’t change our wifi network and connection was never a problem with the old app unless the wifi was actually down due to a power or internet outage. With the new app, connection was frequently a problem.)

title: 2 hours. Still not connected
text: The instructions with my unit came out before whatever junk update they did with the app. Can’t get past a “Step 1 Connect this device to your Geo”. I get the geo WiFi on my phone, can’t do anything with it. I leave the app and go back in, I have to start the whole process over. The only button I get to move on to step 2 says “open settings” which just brings up location data that I already have enabled. Sometimes I can connect to the geo WiFi, sometimes I can’t. Repeatedly go through “scanning” on the unit. Never get more than a “disconnected” screen. Read the directions over and over, started from scratch 300+ times, had 2 other people try. Nothing. What a confusing pile of feces. 0/10 would NEVER recommend.

title: Unprofessional company, horrible new app
text:
1. They sent no emails to customers that they are replacing the app and people will lose remote access to thermostats and will have to reconnect. They care less about customers
2. New came out of the blue and after 15 tries and one hour struggle I’ve managed to bring my Kono thermostat back online.
3. Immediately found bunch of issues:
- horrible interface, you have to click some random ugly icons to get what you need
- to change temp you have to click 3 times before you can: open app, click location, click thermostat, finally can adjust 
- adjusting temp is a stupid dial now, you never know which way to soon it, it has super loud annoying sound that wakes up my wife at nigh if I use it
- it killed scheduling! The local time was incorrect so the schedule had no sense
- it enabled geofencing without asking, three is no easy way to see if it is enabled 
App looks like it was designed by a child, it is a horrible junk that is an example of how now to design a thermostat app.
Sent support requests - nobody ever replied to me. Stay away from Lux, I’m getting Ecobee and Kono goes to where it came from.

title: Big update seems to have broken the connection entirely.
text:
Update:
A couple of weeks later, the app still wont go further than “updating firmware” and I can only assume the thermostat is permanently in dumb state. None of the multiple avenues of contact to the company have been responded to. The app has not further been updated to address the widespread problems.
Congrats, Lux, you’ve created another Nest customer.
—————
Supposedly “updating the firmware” for a couple of days now. Thermostat which had worked fine for a couple years now offline. No evident way to fix that, no apparent way to contact the company — no response to emails or site chat. The Fall 2020 update seems to have broken a lot of people’s thermostats. Will replace if not remedied within the next week or two.

title: Does not function since the “new and improved app”
text: I bout the Lux Geo in 2018 for the furnace at our cottage, specifically because it’s an old in wall furnace with no C wire, and I wanted a thermostat that would function on battery power alone. The Geo was perfect, and did well until now. With the new app update, I can no longer connect remotely to the thermostat, no matter how many times I try to rescan the network. In fact, the app now gets stuck in an endless loop when I try to configure the network settings from it. The old version of the app was intuitive, and most importantly, worked perfectly. I now have Lux Geo that functions no differently than the old thermostat that was on the furnace. Very disappointed. Go back to the app version that worked for all of us!

title: Last update removed the ability to set remotely
text:
Edit.  My issues with inability to change the temp remotely were user error. Support promptly responded to my support request and corrected my issue. Again, the simple wiring for this device makes it a superb choice for heat pump only units. 

It seems the last update removed the ability to set the temperature remotely. I’m traveling and rely on this to keep the pipes from freezing (winter is coming). Other than this issue, the thermostat has been great and was the easiest to install since it didn’t require a complex wiring solution.

title: Worse new app and malfunctioning hardware
text: I used the Lux Geo and this app with no issues for about a year. After that it has been nothing but trouble. The thermostat constantly drops connection and reads temperatures that are wildly inaccurate. The new app initially screwed up all my settings and it took me a couple tries to get them set again. Making adjustments on the app is no user friendly so I try to only use the actual thermostat for changes. It makes having a smart thermostat pretty much useless. I’ve contacted their service multiple times about the connection issues and they’ve given me ‘fixes’ that don’t work. Seems like they’re away that the hardware has issues but don’t want to keep sending out warranty replacements.

title: Updated the app and then needed to re-link WiFi
text:
This app used to work perfect. They did a major UI change and then my app to the thermostat lost all
Connection. After some trouble shooting I re-did the whole set up again and got it working. They should have notified via the old app to do the update as I was getting a server error trying to use the previous app. I tried support and they never got back to me. Minus this issue it’s been a great thermostat, it’s way more accurate than my old Honeywell. I hope in the future the Devs will consider a better notification system to the user for major changes like this.

title: You broke it
text: Too bad it isn’t possible to give a zero rating. This worked fine before the firmware ‘update’. Now it’s a joke. The app says the device is updating but it must be a permanent state of update because it never changes. You can’t connect to the thermostat via internet to control and when I deleted device to add it back and try to reset it the only button available on the app when you are connecting to the device now is ‘Open Settings’ so you can’t actually move to the next step. If the goal was to get everyone to throw their Lux thermostats in the trash it is working. There is no response from support and they must have used actual monkeys to test this app. I’m going to buy a Honeywell device.

title: Best one!
text: I bought this before nest came out and it was the only one that would go portrait mode to fit on a really narrow piece of wall. Also with a display I don’t have to wear glasses to read. I ran this on batteries in balanced mode for years, swapping batteries about every 6 months. Recently it started mid reading the battery level saying it was too low after a few days and dropping the WiFi. The company shipped me a new unit!! I also hooked up the C wire which I had been meaning to do for years. The schedule copied over to the new unit with  few clicks. Easy peasy!

title: Responsive to issues - much improved
text: The app has had some problems culminating recently. I emailed and then called customer service. I was shocked that the phone call was promptly answered and someone tecorded my concerns. My email was promptly followed up in a manner that made it clear they were working on the problem (by David Cahill). As of today the connectivity and runtime and temp data recording issues are fully corrected. 5 stars for this unheard of customer service and defication to correcting a problem.

title: New version is a joke
text:
The old version of the app was clean and functioned perfectly. This new version is clumsy and difficult to navigate. Changing the temperature is a joke, as it goes far past what you want to set it at. 

It frequently shows the thermostat being offline when it isn’t. I’ve taken to just changing the temp at the thermostat itself, which defeats the purpose of having the app. Had I known Lux was going to do this when I bought the thermostat, I would have purchased from a competitor. Don’t waste your money.

Update February 5, 2021.

The new app is still useless. They keep adding cheesy bells and whistles and don’t fix the functionality. It still takes several tries to change the temp as it keeps changing back. 

I had called customer support and told them switching back to the old version would earn respect from customers until they can get ALL of the bugs out. He flatly said that would never happen. It’s disappointing to see what was such a fine product go completely in the toilet because they’re too proud to admit their new app is bad.

title: Created Account, Can’t Sign In
text:
If I had read the app reviews before I bought this thermostat, I wouldn’t have bought it. Johnson Controls is a huge company, and somehow can’t hire competent app developers?

After downloading the app on ios, I created my account, complete with email verification. Then, it made me start at the beginning and sign in again. Only it said User Not Found. Gave it 8 hours and tried it again: User Not Found.

Deleted and reloaded the app, and created my account again, however, I CAN’T, because it says there is already a User with my email name. 

This is amateur stuff.  Fix this Johnson!!!!!!!!!

Update:  The app is now working. Tech support was able to help me figure out that the app would not accept my gmail email address, and that if I used a different email address, it may accept it, and it did. The app is confusing at first, but does seem to work on my iPhone.

Second Update:  App is working. Simple to use, but the schedule created on the app would not upload to the thermostat. Had to do the schedule on the thermostat and then it appeared on the app.

title: Lux smart thermostats used to be the best
text: So i have had the geo thermostats in my home for over 4 years. They had been working great until the last few months in conjunction it seems with the recent app redesign. Now they go offline 3-4 times a week (not a local wireless issue, trust me on that) and when offline dont control the temp very well. I added a kono two years ago and it has started to exhibit the same issues around the same time as the geos did. The app, btw, is not very intuitive and really a major leap backwards from the previous version. I will plead here for lux to correct these issues soon or i will have to replace them as they simply do not control our temperature properly when they go offline.

title: Latest update is a downgrade
text: While the previous version of this app was not groundbreaking by any means, it at least worked. This garbage update renders my “connected” thermostat useless. I could look past the awful UI if the app actually worked. But since I’ve updated the app (which was rolled out in the most cumbersome way possible… the old app simply stopped working, so I was forced to update it with no prior notice), my thermostat has major connectivity issues. Rarely is it connected to my WiFi, and when it is connected it’s sporadic at best. And, no, the problem is not my WiFi. This appears to be a common issue with this new app. I implore this company to revert back to the previous app. Or fix this shameful “upgrade”.

title: It doesn’t work, so neither does the thermostat
text: I had to replace my router.  Subsequently unable to re-establish WiFi connection in spite of multiple attempts, repeat download of app, reset router, etc.  The app is necessary to set up the thermostat, and simply freezes during the install process.  Tried on three separate apple devices.  Tech support gave up, had no answers - but is sending me a new Geo even though it’s obvious that’s not the problem; it worked fine, installed easily with the old app, no problems until I had to connect to the new router.  This app has had other problems as well.  Too bad, a fairly good thermostat rendered useless by this terrible app.  Stay away, there are plenty of alternatives.

title: Awful
text:
This has to be the worst app in the history of mankind.  If you have programmed a low temperature for night and want to adjust the temperature higher when u get up early good luck.  They have a wheel For u to figure out.  It’s red on on one side and blue the other but if your night temp is 62 and you try to spin the wheel it immediately goes to a schedule screen and you haven’t done anything yet because that temp of 70 just won’t come up no matter how you spin it.
And each time u spin it the schedule screen returns.  U can only go a few degrees at a time and each time u need to start over.

Don’t buy a Lux if you want a wifi thermostat .  They need to fire their whole IT group or child whomever it may be.

title: Won’t stay connected to wifi
text: Bought a geo in the summer of 2020 for my cabin 200 miles away. It worked fine until the new app update and ever since then it loses it’s connection to the WiFi and doesn’t reconnect like the website says it should. This is a problem because I bought this to monitor my cabin over the winter to prevent a furnace problem and possible freeze. After numerous calls to customer service and emails with managers, I was basically told that they’re having this issue with the app on iOS devices and are working on it. The advised me to keep checking the website for updates. Meanwhile my cabin sits 200 miles away and I have no idea if the heat is even working.

title: Updated app is even worse
text:
Can you believe that the updated app is worse than the last one. It now limits the minimum heat setting to 50 deg F, which is no good for zones where you just need freeze protection (needs to go down to 40 deg F). Why impose a limit on the temperature setting ? The previous app let you set any temperature you want. 
Also, every time the app is open, it asks you which system you want to check. The old app defaulted to the last one you checked (most homes have only one system, so why ask you each time ?). 
And many other irritating points added to. 
The app has been developed with emphasis on looking good, at the expense of it actually doing what you need.

title: WORST APP AND PRODUCT EVER!!!
text: DO NOT BUY THIS THERMOSTAT.  Look at the ratings. It is horrible.  From the thermostat to the app to the support...worst ever. Support ignores you. They are aware of problems and don’t fix them. It has a dial system. I was leaving town for 3 days so I turned the thermostat OFF. When I exited the app, it dialed to HEAT. My heater ran for 3 days at 90 degrees!!!  My gas bill quadrupled. The app required signing in every single time you used it, even if it was 2 minutes later. They knew about the problem but told me they had bigger issues. The only way to get help is email. You can’t call. I replaced my LUX with a Google Nest today. Run as far and as fast as you can from LUX.  Crappy product and DEPLORABLE customer service.

title: Worst device ever!
text:
I installed one of these three years ago, and it was a struggle to understand how to set the controls. I finally muddled my way through they confused and bizarre instructions for setting the schedule, etc. 
Connecting to my Wi-Fi network was a real pain! User interface is right out of the 1970s  and - the”new app”Is just as poor as the original. 
Topping it all off: After three years the unit has failed: the only option it offers is “Cool,”
no “Heat” option so it’s useless, as I don’t have central A/C. When I launch the App it says it’s downloading software - and it has said the same thing for months. 
Huge waste of my time and money - I’ll replace it with a $12 Honeywell round unit…

title: CS1
text:
Worked great for a month but now both thermostats are dropping WiFi connection, have stopped recording run time and temperature, and are not able to be controlled from the iOS app. Can still use these manually, but I can buy thermostats with only that functionality much cheaper.

Update: After about a week of the above troubles, the issue resolved itself. Not sure what changed, but no troubles since. Thermostat and associates app do what they need to and do so user-friendly enough.

title: BEWARE OF KONO SERVICE & DO NOT LOAD APP
text: Loaded this app and immediately both of my Konos WIFI capability quit and were no longer able to connect to wifi. For over three months now been going back and forth with customer service and Customer Service unable to fix. Weeks at a time each time for customer service to respond.  When they do...they are unable to fix issue.  Asked for old app as many Kono owners are and get zero response. Bottom line...have two Kono’s that will not connect to wifi immediately after new app install.  This was the sole purpose for purchasing these thermostats. Don’t waste your time or $$ on LUX products and customer service.

title: Finally gave up
text:
With winter weather finally here, it's simply unsafe to have a non functioning thermostat, which is what the Lux had become thanks to the "updates." Johnson Controls clearly doesn't care based on their lack of responses to calls/emails to customer service and lack of reviewing reviews and fixing, or at least abandoning, the new app.  They also must have the most incompetent development team around.

I finally gave up.  The main attractions for the Geo were I could use without a c-wire and the app USED TO work really well.  Figured out a c-wire workaround and spent another $150+ to get an Emerson Sensi.  Boxing up the Lux and sending it back, in pieces, since it's a useless piece of trash to me.

title: Kono app works very well bridge mode
text:
I used the bridge mode and it works fine. 
I love using the app to control the temp in my room without going to the thermostat.
The only reason I didn’t give it a 5 stars is because Of the on off schedule.  My old thermostat had a morning/noon/night schedule so that u did t have to think about on/off much. This one only has a one setting for the day feature.  I’m hoping they add an update for multiple time zone temps.  
Over all, easy to install (see videos first). 
Beautiful bright display on the thermostat.

title: Terrible app ruins good hardware
text:
If you love apps that make you sign in every single time you open them, and also are extremely difficult to use, and actually don’t work, this is the app for you. 

I sometimes wonder if the owners of the thermostats can start a class action suit against the manufacturer for ruining their devices. 

The latest horror, if you can even get signed in, and then figure out the app, it is incredibly slow (think minutes) to refresh and to update the thermostat.

Worst of all, now it updates the thermostat with the wrong data. Tonight I tested it - thermostat running its program and set to 69 degrees. Open the app, it says it is set to 74 (the previous setting for the previous time in the program). I set the app down to 67 and stand by the thermostat and watch it, after a couple minutes, not move down to 67 but instead go up, back to 74.

This app is trash and the manufacturer should be ashamed. Offer people their money back for their thermostats.

title: Terrible update. Bricked one of my units
text:
Have two LuxGeo units. Both were working fine for about 4 years until they pushed out the new update. Then one unit would not respond to any commands from the app. Constantly showing as offline even though I see it ony WiFi network and can ping the unit. Tried resetting unit, removing and adding to my account. Nothing works. Called support and they said wait a week to see if the issue clears up on their end.
They also removed some features such as locking the unit but allowing temp control only. Also took away the web portal which was useful. Customer service has been pretty awful too.

title: Disappointed
text: I have had a Lux Geo for a while now. It has not worked properly since the first time change the unit experienced. At that time I reached out for help. It took several attempts to get a response and even then the customer service was poor and my issue was not resolved. I had to rig the time settings for the unit to run when desired. Then the app update. When that occurred I was hopeful the unit would operate as desired. As with the numerous other reviews that was not the case, it got worse. Recently I looked back in the App Store and see developer responses to a number or reviewers. I am posting in hopes I can get help too.

title: One star only because I can’t do Zero!
text:
Update: After months of fighting with the app, we are going to replace the whole thermostat with another brand. It is totally ridiculous to have a product such as this with a totally unreliable and non working app! DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!

The updated app is horrible! This company needs to fire whomever did the design. They took a very simple easy to use application and made it extremely complicated and difficult to use. If we continue to have issues we will be removing the thermostat completely and replacing it. All due to a horribly designed application and user interface!

title: Easy to use
text:
The system is easy to use and works very well. I have been using this system for about 5 years and have had no problems. 

On the other hand, the update to the app is a setback in its design. The original app layout you could see each thermostat, what it’s current temp was and the mode. Now you have to go into each one to view any information. Otherwise I do like the controls when in a specific thermostat.

title: WiFi Issue
text:
Edit- App continues to say my device has lost connection. Never had this issue until the latest update. Needs to be looked at. 

Taking the GEO off the wall and holding reset for 3 seconds brought it back online in the app without deleting any hardware settings. Hope that helps some. I’ve bumped my rating up due to the developers actually listening to us and providing us with the old app interface.

title: Johnson Controls/LUX makes it hard to find the love
text: I own seven GEOs and was happy with them.  Then Johnson Controls took over LUX and oversaw the worst (comical actually) app update I could ever imagine.  Those of us who had committed to the hardware stood by and the company listened and added the “classic” interface back to the app and things looked good again for a while, BUT now the app randomly reports a thermostat as off-line even though the thermostat shows as full signal strength and connected.  I suspect this new issue is a fault in the Johnson Controls servers, but in any case a Wi-Fi thermostat that you can’t connect to is more than worthless, it’s a liability.

title: App is awful
text: Initially after setup everything worked well until I was randomly signed out one day. I was then locked out of my account for days, deleted and re-downloaded the app, was then able to get back into my account but the wall unit didn’t want to reconnect with the app. I was fed up and gave up for a few months. Decided a few days ago to reset it up with the app only to find out I’m logged out every single time I close the app and that changes I make on the app aren’t even happening on the wall unit. What’s the point of the app if it doesn’t do the basic functions that are advertised?

title: Works Now
text: This is a revised review. My initial review was 1 star. I bumped it up to 3 stars because customer service was very attentive after my initial review. We worked together and identified the hardware as being faulty. Lux sent me a new unit and my Geo thermostat now connects to the Lux server and the app now works properly with the Geo unit. I would have given 4 stars but the design of the app isn’t the greatest. The hardware works as it should and the customer service department deserves 5 stars. For those with ongoing issues, please contact customer service.

title: Ridiculous
text: As stated so many times before and other reviews why doesn’t your company go back to the old app? It reminds me of the time that Coke tried to change the recipe and  it ended up being a flop! They licked their wounds put back out the old recipe and all was forgiven! I challenge you to look at your reviews of your old app compared to this one and give all of us a fair reason why you continue down this ridiculous road! The new app is clumsy, not intuitive! And downright frustrating! We all make mistakes, some seem to learn from them! And your company seems to continue them!

title: Works well, for the most part
text:
If you’re using a Geo device, it does seem to take a minute or two for updates to go from the app to the thermostat. On Kono, the changes appear almost instantaneously.

The new design is much cleaner than the old app, and the ability to tap on the weather bar to see a forecast is nice. The dial takes a little while to get used to, but provides a unique experience.

Overall, I love the update

title: Update Makes a poor app even worse!
text: At least the old app for the Geo would reliably report temp. The new app was a major step backwards in terms of reliability.  The updated and allegedly “fixed” version this past week broke everything.  Can no longer set the schedule remotely.  Arrived at our country house and the display orientation had changed.  After adjusting the schedule remotely the set temp wouldn’t change.  20 minutes later when I check, the app tells me the heat is off.  Terrific.  What a piece of garbage.  If I didn’t have tempsticks in the house I wouldn’t know what was happening.

title: Iphone 11 pro
text: With the new iphone11 pro the screen for the settings is too big now and has slipped off the left side of screen so you cant adjust the temperatures.  Outside of that is has worked great before in iohe 7.  Also for those using lithium batteries if have used them for 2 years in balanced mode.  Replace them every 4 months and there was zero issues.  Make sure you hit battery reset on thre unit attached to wall, that caused me an issue once despite javing fresh batteries

title: No longer usable
text: Used to work great but now I’m going to need to buy a new thermostat. The app basically doesn’t work. The set point is randomly set to 70 half the time so I can’t trust the automatic schedule. When manually controlling the temperature, the app only actually changes the temperature about half the time. We used to get emails when the batteries were getting low- didn’t get those emails this time and the batteries died when we were gone for a weekend. We were very fortunate to not have frozen pipes. I can’t understand how the app went from being so good to so atrociously bad.

title: Redo of app took a full reset and widget doesn’t work for me
text:
I thought the old interface was better. When the upgrade came out i was forced to use it and had similar issues as others have reported. It required full power cycle and reset but was finally able to get it to work. 
Tried adding the newly released widget but that doesn’t work. It just opens the home screen for LUX and then disappears? I had to delete app and reinstall to get things back.

title: Horrible update
text:
This app is totally broken. I was so excited 2 years ago when I set up 3 zones in my house using Lux, everything worked great.  But the recent update has completely broken the functionality and made this a totally frustrating and disappointing component of my life. I will never purchase a LUX product again. They have shown a complete disregard for their customers with this app update. No QA whatsoever. They simply pushed a broken app out to the world. They keep promising updates (via v2.0.63) but good luck getting it. You only get the still broken and buggy 2.0.13. 
Good Bye Lux.

title: Return your LUX ASAP!!!
text:
It’s a nice looking thermostat, but if you want something nice to hang on your wall, buy some art. 

This thing has been a headache since I’ve gotten it. I’ve had this for about 8 months and it’s just been one headache after the other. Got our power bill for the month and it was 3x it’s normal cost. So I got curious and cut off the air. Well, the HVAC fan stayed on. I looked at the settings on the thermostat and they’re at Auto, but could not turn the fan off. Even by powering the thermostat down. When I took it off the wall and put it back, it started to run correctly again, but not before costing me $200. 

Furthermore, anytime your power flickers it’s completely unable to just reconnect to the WiFi and is a huge pain to re setup.

To add insult to injury, this company (Johnson Controls) has fake reviews on their website and when you review the product, the review just disappears. This is literally the only place you can actually review it.

title: Doesn’t deserve one star
text:
This app is crap after the update. Doesn’t work reliably, constantly need to reset the thermostat, won’t keep internet connection, not user friendly at all. 
Never had these issues with previous version. Read the other reviews. Was it “bring your toddler to work day” in the development department?
Sure hope they do something-like bring back the old app that worked just fine, particularly since heating season is right around the corner.
We may be shopping for another thermostat because if they don’t so something hugely productive.

title: Bring back the old app
text: As many others have said the new user interface is terrible. Why have a digital “dial” when the simple up and down buttons worked great?  The graphs were much easier to read on the old version, why the change?  Now, when I physically turn the temp up or down it goes into a HOLD status and doesn’t return to the schedule at night - totally stupid. I had to abandon the schedule completely by setting up Alexa routines to perform the schedule functions. Tell your developers simple is better and stop trying to be cute.

title: Don’t waste your money!
text: Concept is great, but is difficult to use. Didn’t have the extra thermostat wire so had to depend on batteries. Went on a trip and left state for warmer climate, installed batteries per instructions, lasted about 40 days. Freezing temperatures forced me to have heater company to come and change thermostat for double what I paid for Lux thermostat. Wished I had read the reviews before purchasing. Batteries die heat and air won’t work. Had neighbors come and attempted change batteries and broke a piece of back of thermostat. Shouldn’t be so difficult to change if you constantly changing batteries.

title: Simple and straightforward.
text: I connected my thermostat using the usb power connection because my c-wire doesn’t work and on battery power the commands from the app are delayed. It works fine and it changes the temperature immediately from the app. This thing also saves me money with the program schedule and the geofencing away mode. If you are on a budget look at this product.

title: Please fix!
text: This device was never perfect but that update that came through several months ago has made it go from OK to horrible. Unreliable at best in the past recent months and now keeps dropping the connection to my iPhone. It won’t let me login and keeps bringing me to the login page. Then I get ALERT: Device offline. I keep searching the comments looking for some kind of a response on what the developer or Lux is doing about this but can’t seem to find anything. Hopefully someone reaches out before I switch to another well reviewed brand.

title: Too Little, too late
text: Today, after completely F’ing up my Lux which I had for years, I get an email about a great software release to fix a number of problems. These problems should have never been introduced into the wonderful “new and improved” piece of crap app that got shoved down our throats in the first place. I got tired of waiting for you to fix this product. It is off the wall and replaced with an ECOBee. I suggest to everyone to never get something related to LUX. Their software is written by morons that have no clue how to test a product. So long and good riddance to this garbage.

title: Best WiFi with no C wire
text: I've looked around and tried a couple of other WiFi thermostats. You need to give these guys credit for being clear about the need for a C wire. Nest tries to hide the issue.  I have five of them installed. They work well on balanced battery mode. But, when I am away for an extended period during the winter I plug them in with the clever USB power option. Once again, Lux directly addressing the C wire issue. There's no magic but these are pretty close.

title: Do not buy the Lux Thermostat
text: I owned two thermostats and they worked fine. One year ago the company went through changes and the thermostats have been unreliable ever since. I’ve spent the last year never knowing when the companies servers would go down or bump the thermostats off the network. This has nothing to do with the WiFi at both homes, the main servers at the company are unreliable. After a year of spending hours reconnecting each thermostat every 3-4 weeks I have given up and am throwing them in the garbage.

title: Poor Communication With Customer Service
text: I purchased this unit for my personal home and planned to link to my apple phone. After many updates of software, new router, change to my kindle, still no luck linking to the LUX. The Lux itself was stuck updating firmware and failed every time.. Attempted to contact customer service, via email. Received an automated reply that someone with be in contact with me in 1-2 business days. That was over a month ago. Second, that unit uses batteries every 3-5 weeks. Will be replacing with another brand.

title: New update made this worthless
text: Constantly looses connection and my router is two feet from my thermostat. The latest update ruined my product. Will not buy another Lux. I also sent email months ago none were return except a general reply all   I’m assuming they were flooded with email because customers had the same issue. Disappointing.

title: Works great… but to conserve battery, it isn’t instant
text: This is the only WiFi thermostat that I’m aware of that works on millivolt systems and doesn’t require a common wire.   Lyric and Nest claim to, but I’ve never been able to get them to work consistently.   It is able to work off batteries because it isn’t connected all the time, just every few minutes or so.

title: New app is terrible
text: I have had 4 Geos for a few years. The old app was just fine from a usability perspective. The new app is shiny and pretty but is very difficult to use. The temperature dial concept looks cool but is backwards and horrible for changes more than 2 degrees. The new scheduling is difficult to use and I can’t find how to copy schedules so I have to suffer times 4. The home screen used to show all my thermostats comfortably in large font, the new one has a lot of wasted space and the info I care about is tiny and doesn’t quite fit.

title: Giving Up
text: The old app wasn’t the most beautiful but at least it usually worked.  I bought this thermostat because it didn’t require a C wire and it wasn’t the greatest but it worked well enough for the basic stuff.  Now I can’t get the app to reconnect or even tell if it’s connected (it used to tell me when it last contacted the thermostat).  It seems to be randomly setting temperatures and I just pulled the thermostat off the wall when I couldn’t get the heat to stop.  I won’t buy another Lux Geo product or recommend them.

title: New version is awful
text:
New version - more bugs.
- Runtime/temperature graph no longer works!!! (Error at request time)
Clueless!!!

New version is a step back 
- Drains iphone battery (15% of total battery daily use!!!! Barely open)
- Poor temperature controls
- Unintuitive schedule editor (and need to reenter all schedules), repeatedly loses entered schedules.
- Manual adjustment lost option "adjust till next schedule change", MUST enter time!!! This is ridiculous - no more quick temp up/down!!! (Hint: don't ask user for more inputs unless user told you he needs that)
- Does not actually reflect changes in set temperature - so no way to tell if the adjustment was applied.
- Lost all historic runtime information.

This thing is a joke - who thought this is an improvement?

Unfortunately, old app seems to no longer work. Will be looking for a new thermostat asap.

title: New app update is horrible
text:
Apparently the app updated. My system lost connection while I was away. It took over an hour to reestablish wifi. It now looses wifi constantly. If it keeps it up, I will have no choice but to go buy a different brand.
The new app is horrible. I now have to relearn how to navigate it.
My question is why?  Why overhaul the entire look all at once? Go back to the old one and just refine it if you think it needs it. Or give me the choice on the layout. I had no problem with the way it was.

title: New 2.0 app is bad.   The people who designed it must not use it.
text: Sorry there isn’t a rating less than one star.   Previous version was perfectly fine and simple to use.   New version is overly engineered by someone who must not actually use the interface in their home.      It is now just far simpler to just walk up to the thermostat to raise or lower the temperature.   Plus it continually sends out false change-filter notices.   Will probably replace entire unit as it defeats the purpose and convenience of a smart thermostat.   DO NOT BUY!

title: Return your thermostat, app is garbage
text: Agree with most other users. This app is garbage. Unfortunately it is linked to my hardware, which is now unable to connect to the WiFi. Expensive hardware functions like a $10 thermostat. Wow, what a show of malpractice. Lux, please step up, fire these useless developers and get a new team on board. Otherwise very soon this app will put you out of business. Just look at the big fixes they had to do: those should not even have happened before the alpha version!! Unbelievable.

title: Keeps losing connection
text:
At least weekly, the thermostat loses Wi-Fi connection and had to be reset. Yes, there are times when my Wi-Fi goes down, but other electronics can pick it right up when the Wi-Fi comes back on. Not this thermostat.  Also, the app update took a very simple app and made it complex.  Simply having the AC come on temporarily went from a one-step process to three or four steps.

I got this because I lacked a C wire. With a recent furnace installation, I had my HVAC guy run a C wire to the thermostat so I can replace this one with something better.

title: Update a failure
text:
Prior app worked flawlessly for me. Don’t  know reasons for such a drastic update. Maybe you had good ones. But, the update is clunky, not intuitive and isn’t working. I can’t even create a simple schedule - the app just cancels all attempts at creating one with an indication “schedule is off”. Try again, same result. 

So, your smart thermostat has lost basic REQUIRED features. Pretty dumb! If no, quick update to fix obvious problems, its dumpster time. I’ll be buying a Nest. Thanks for replying to my email seeking help by the way...NOT!!!

title: Update messed up a decent thermostat
text: An update was forced on the system and it happened at the worst possible time, while I was away. I had counted on some energy savings while I was away, but due to the update on my iPhone, and that fact that I wasn’t near the thermostat, It kept my home nicely cool when I was 500 miles away! Since returning home the new updated app has crashed and the schedule has stopped working four times. Thanks for nothing! Fix it or I’ll be buying a different product.

title: Clunky app
text: Only allows exactly 4 time periods--no more, no less, which doesn't fit my schedule. Unadjustably names the 4 periods, and doesn't handle after-midnight bedtimes sensibly, so my bed-to-wake nighttime period has to be called "morning", my wake-to-leave period in the morning has to be called "day", etc--not that big a deal, but it makes the initial scheduling confusing, and both of these seem like easy fixes.

title: Worked fine until I had to change modems
text: I had to recently upgrade my WiFi modem and there is no way to change the modem name without completely removing the thermostat and putting a new one in the app.  Additionally,  there is no notification for the battery life on the modem in the app.  The only way I find out the battery is dead is to find the thermostat blank when I walk pass.

title: It’s OK
text: The app works fine for the most part. My biggest complaint is that they seem behind on general ease of app use. I have to sign in every single time. There’s no option for fingerprint or just to stay logged in.   Programming settings could be a lot easier too. It’s as if they had to make everything just a little bit more complicated than necessary.

title: Very irritating
text: The previous version of this app was decent, but the app updated automatically when I updated my iPhone operating system and this new Lux update is ridiculously annoying. It is very difficult to use and understand, not at all user friendly. The schedule settings are a nightmare. Would not recommend at all! At the very least, try to keep the previous version of the app as long as possible! It has been nothing but a headache since the unfortunate update.

title: Good App, Terrible Customer Support
text:
The app is fine. I wish you could do everything in it that you can do from the unit, but I understand why this isn’t the case, so it’s not a big deal.

The big problem I have with Lux is their incredibly rude customer support. I first emailed, then called to discuss an issue I have been having, and all they kept telling me was that “that doesn’t happen” and “it doesn’t work that way” even though I explained to them in detail what has been occurring. Rather than try to solve my issue, they simply said it does not occur.

title: Doesn’t deserve a single star
text:
This may be the single worst company for technical support that I have encountered in years. Their phone number has been suspended for “maintenance“, their chat online is disabled and will only allow you to leave a message. The app is unable to connect to the thermostat and set up is continually aborted.

We will be removing this product from our home and researching its replacement a little more carefully than we did the first time.

Save your money and your patience by staying as far away from this product as possible.

title: Only connects 1 day out of every 5 you try.
text: If it worked it would just be a terribly designed, unintuitive, difficult to use app. Unfortunately, it almost never works, and just leaves you on a “please wait” spinning-wheel page while it tries to connect to the thermostat that you’re standing in front of, on the same wifi network as your phone, right next to the router... the only reason it gets one star is because it does work every 5th day that you try it.

title: Junk
text: App does not function the way the instructions describe.  Developer’s App help link leads to a general home page.  Lux’s tutorial on connecting the thermostat to the app is outdated with old pictures.  You’re supposed to connect the phone/app to the thermostat’s wifi (success) in iOS settings, and return to the app to then choose a lost of networks to find and connect to your own (fail... a dozen times).  The list of networks never display in the app like the direction on the app and in the thermostat says it will.  Junk.

title: Worst system ever
text: To add to an already nearly useless app, I now have to login every single time I open it. Even if I forget to check a setting and go right back in after I just left. That’s just dumb!  Most of the time the app says totally different temps than the wall thermostats even though everything is supposedly connected. These are junk. Don’t buy them until they can get their act together and put out products that actually work in a cohesive manner.

title: Absolute Disaster. Roll back to old app now
text: I’m not going to waste my time telling you what’s wrong with this app. Why? Because you had a perfectly good app and now you “fixed everything” but actually ruined everything. Simple temperature controls doesn’t even work, the schedule is a nightmare, the UI is confusing, and the graphs make no sense (and also don’t convert C/F). There was no testing done on this app. Roll back the old version and have a proper developer fix this app or make a new one.

title: New update took away the only feature I use
text:
I never leave bad reviews. But I have a serious complaint. 

I have these in 12 properties where I need a smart thermostats that I can adjust between guest remotely. Equally as important is having the ability to lock all adjustments except temp control, allowing only the thermostat to be turned up and down, that’s it. You wouldn’t believe how many guest will mess you all settings and then call at midnight to have it fixed. 

The new update took this feature away. If you lock the thermostat, the guest can’t adjust the thermostat. If you leave it unlocked, it gives guest access to a very complicated and confusing dial.

I have bought 10+ of these and if this update isn’t fixed, will switch out all units to a new thermostat.

title: New app is awful!
text: Had thermostat for approximately 3 years and like everything about it. Made me update to the new app and now home/away works when it want to. Setting the temperature is a mess and you never know what the app is going to sync with the thermostat so you have to give it time then see what it updates to. Sometimes it may be 5 degrees from what you set it to. So easy to find, read, set, what you wanted before and it all worked! Please give us our old app back!!

title: Bring back old app!
text: The new app is absolutely horrible. Loses connection with thermostats, doesn’t let you change the temp in the house remotely, reliably, only does it every other time at best. Lost a lot of options the old app had. Talk about a bait and switch. Buy this and for a couple months you’ll have a great app that does what we promised. Then we will pull that app out from under you and leave you with a buggy app a 9 year old could have created better.

title: Update lacking
text: After 4 years of screen resolution support for smaller iPhones only, that is finally fixed. However, after signing in my schedule is missing and the web site portion for it no longer exists. Also the app icon itself doesn’t seem like it was made for Retina as it is low resolution and pixelated. Kind of makes you wonder who signed off on this poor effort. And geofencing status for connected devices is no longer available.

title: Weak product—do not recommend
text: I have had this product for over a year now. , and it has progressed from being ok to poor. The attributes that make it poor are 1) poor technical documentation, especially regarding set up 2) display beginning to show black splotches 3) depletes up to lithium batteries (must use lithium) at a rapid pace, and 4) continues to go “off-line”.  The device is located about 20 feet from the route with practically no intervening walls.   Overall, I rate this product as weak and not a good value.

title: Aweful products
text:
Using the smart thermostat and this app, worse purchase I’ve made when it comes to smart devices. 

EVERYDAY I have connectivity issues with these products. Unfortunately it’s not easy to just buy and replace with another thermostat.
For the money you save on these garbage lux products you will regret it later dealing with the headaches of various issues. 

The app is not as user friendly as it seems at first glance. Every time you change a setting in the app I.e. temp, schedule etc you cannot close out the app until the settings take affect which essentially means you could be sitting with your phone open for longer than what it would’ve taken you to just make the adjustment manually.

Waste of money and cheaply made product

title: Goes offline, stops heating
text: We’ve had two, one for each zone for a few years. The concept is great. Execution is not. When ours go offline, they stop functioning. That means no ac, no heat while offline. It’s getting progressively worse. This week alone they have gone offline 4 times, twice in one day. I don’t notice until I realize the temp is colder than it should be. If I could give lower than one star, not just for the app but the Lux product as a whole I would.

title: Features Lacking
text: The device needs to be able to have a way to set a range of heating and cooling temperatures from HomeKit. The Auto mode is too narrow of a range. The device will constantly switch from heat to cool throughout the day. Also HomeKit support is very spotty in other ways. When temperatures are set with HomeKit the degrees you want set always jump 1-5 units around what you actually set. Very annoying.

title: More of a headache the it’s worth
text: Don’t spend your money.. this unit disconnects from WiFi more then it’s connected...there is no lock control so other cant get into the setting if it’s lock all functions are locked. What good is that. My tenant keeps Turing it up to 84 and locking me out.  I am on the second floor and my unit temp hit 87 when it’s 43 outside. What a waste. The app has not been updated in 6 years.

title: Works Great
text: I’ve been using the app and thermostat for close to two years and it works great. I have been running it on batteries and have not required the 3rd wire adapter offered by the manufacturer since I have only had to replace the batteries once.

title: Great Thermostat
text: I’ve had the Lux Geo for two years and have had no issues. I’ve read complaints about batteries and when using the balanced battery mode, I might replace a battery once every 6 months. I only wish the app had better runtime analytics to compare usage by week, month, year and against average outdoor temperatures.

title: It’s a disaster
text: I’ve had the thermostat and used the app for over a couple years now but recently with the newest update, the app is a complete disaster! It will not follow your commands, goes off-line, reminds you to change your air filter 10 times, and I’ve had to delete and reinstall the app several times in the last few months. I don’t know what they did but it used to be a great app. Now it’s going to be deleted for good.

title: New app not user friendly.
text: This new app is not at all user friendly. I can no longer just click “Away” to set the temperature to a set “low” temperature. You have to adjust the temperature a few degrees at a time, then pause the schedule then repeat this about 10 times to get down to your “away” temp. Big waste of time. The interface is much less intuitive vs. the previous one. Please bring back the old app!!

title: I don’t usually write reviews, but....
text:
The app works well enough, however the app hasn’t been updated for phones released even 3 years ago! The iPhone X, XS, XR, 11, etc display this app as if it were an app designed for an iPhone 5. 

App works well, but some updates to bring the interface into this decade would be greatly appreciated.

title: Difficult to control
text: I’m not sure hot to set it up to work correctly.  Auto vs heat.  The control locks don’t take in a timely manner.  I am not expecting instantaneous but within 5 minutes.  I hooked my new thermostat up and it’s been running heat constantly.  I set it to be 63 at the coolest and 69 at the hottest and it’s at 75.  The manual doesn’t give any better instructions and there is no symbol keep on anything that I’ve found.  Super frustrated at this point!

title: Welcome an update to time options
text: App has worked pretty well for me but I am outside the US/Canada/Mexico so the time zones options make it harder to set up the schedule.  Would welcome either more zones, a manual time option, or option to pull the current time off the router.

title: Not staying logged in!
text: While I hate the temperature dial and appreciate the ability to use the classic version, I have been required to log in every time. And using a service that is trying to use a set of credentials from another process, so it is not going well. Not sure what happened, but you need to fix this.

title: Terrible customer support!!
text: We just got one the Geo wifi thermostats, and it quit working after less than two months. The LUX app quit plotting our statistics, so we have no way to know what’s really going on. I contacted their customer support, and they said it was a known issue, but they would not give me any time line on a resolution. I have contacted them again, and they don’t respond.  If I could give the app and LUX zero stars, I would.

title: Not the best
text: The Lux Geo T-stat used to work with Alexa but when Alexa was updated and when I got a new phone and when the WiFi went down....well you get the idea.  Too cumbersome to update the T-stat each time these occur.  So, I don’t use voice control and simply keep to my current schedule and hope for stable WiFi.

title: Good deal for the money.
text: I found it super easy to install , and if it’s done correct when the face is mounted you’ll know when it comes on it’s working .   Not a problem yet with this thermostat. Dirte199

title: Bring back old app
text: I usually don’t write many reviews but this app which I barely use bugged me enough to write one. The new app is horrible functionally and a lot worse aesthetically. Especially when the previous one was so neat. Sometimes you have to come in terms with the fact that you messed up and do the right thing. Listen to the reviews. We love your product just not the recent app.

title: Change batteries
text: The first year I had it it worked fine. Then the batteries went dead and were replaced. Ever since, I can not get the display to work unless a battery is removed and put back in. Then the display works for about one minute and goes away. The app on my iPhone says the GEO is working but I’m not getting any heat. The manual is useless!

title: New App is Horrible
text:
Was bad enough that updating to the new app lost my schedule, but then to get an app that is so much worse than what it replace just adds insult to injury.

Not to mention that the thermostat drops connection frequently; and it’s not my network. My ring door bell and security cams work just fine.

Looks like the poor app will be the final blow and will look for something else.  Too expensive to be this poor.

title: Update Needs an Update!
text: This update is HORRIBLE!  Completely unstable, thermostats constantly drop the WiFi connection now which completely defeats the purpose of them. Sometimes is simple is just better. The old app was simple, easy to use, easy to read. Who’s idea was it to make these new graphs????  It literally goes against the natural flow of things. These update needs a major overhaul and ASAP. Very disappointed!

title: Waste of money- terrible customer service
text: Lux app only works for a few hours then goes offline.   Tech support is no help.  Company will not return my calls or emails as I would like to return the 7 Lux geo thermostats I purchased for a radiant heating system.  I called customer service numerous times and each time they assured me that a supervisor would call back.   Nothing.  And no response from emails to the company.

title: Can’t Add Device Back into Interface
text: I had similar connection problems noted by others and just did a reset on the device and removed it from the interface.  Now I can only get as far as connecting to the device WiFi and can’t get beyond what they labeled as Step 1.  The bottom says “Connect to the network name displayed on your Geo and then return to this app” but nothing ever happens.  ROLL BACK THE APP!!!

title: Garbage
text: Yet another lesson in the world of dumbhome applications.  Really sad that this technology has been around for this long and half to most of the functionality never works.  This thermostat is supposed to know when I’m home and away and set the temp accordingly.  Doesn’t work at all.  I have to set it manually just like every previous thermostat I’ve had going back to the 90’s sooooo smart…

title: Worse app ever
text:
WHY did you discontinue a great app, to be replaced with this impossible to understand app. You gave no advance information to customers, no user guide. The old app just did not work. 
After one week of trying to understand it I am giving up and replacing the thermostat. I loved the simplicity of the original app and the thermostat, now I want nothing to do with it.
Thank you for wasting a $100 for me.

title: Below par
text: The website states it takes 5 minutes for the settings in the app to be pushed to the thermostat. Wrong! It usually takes an hour or more. You’re better of doing it yourself. I don’t understand why there’s no option to manually push settings?!! It works fine if you set a schedule but that’s not nearly as helpful.

title: Great Thermostat BUT......
text:
I just installed the thermostat and it works good. My issue is when I set the thermostat at a certain temperature from the app, there is no indicator to show when the heat is on and when the heat is off due to the temperature reaching the desired number. 
Example - I set it at 74 degrees. I should be able to see when the boiler has turned off and when it turns on again to heat the house. 

Honeywell has an indicator on their app that says “Heat is On” and when the thermostat has stopped calling for heat, it leaves a blank screen in its place. 

Please update this in the next app update and I’ll give this a 5 star.

title: I like the old version better...
text: This app is glitchy. It logs me out of my account ever so often so I have to re login to control my thermostat. The optional heat pump feature went away “emergency heat” now I have to go and turn it on at the thermostat in order to utilize my heat pump. I’m giving this a couple more months before I change to a different manufacturer. Hope you guys can get this fixed.

title: Communication between app and thermostat is painfully slow
text: Changes made by the app are extremely difficult to link to the thermostat. Having an option to sync with the thermostat to communicate changes would be very beneficial. The app is also very difficult to navigate and not user friendly. At this point, I would NOT recommend this thermostat or its app. Very frustrating!

title: Battery notifications and power settings
text: I used to be able to set power consumption on the units and receive battery alerts. Cold weather is here and half my house was freezing one morning I woke up. Batteries dead in one unit and no notifications of battery or loss of connection to the unit like I used to always receive. I really wish I could go back to the old app.

title: From bad to worse
text: It never worked all that great to begin with - wifi connection randomly dropping several times a week.  After the past couple of updates the WiFi drops 5-6 times a day and seems to be getting more frequent.  I have strong WiFi signal in all rooms where they are located but it’s no use.  Can’t rely on these things.

title: POC
text:
Totally useless. Settings change by themselves. Cannot make even the least change to temp settings and expect it to occur. Usually just goes back to the original setting.
Also I’ve received at least 5 emails telling me it’s time to change the furnace filter. For chrysakes I changed it but there’s no longer any way to let the geo know.
A Total POC. The IT fold should be embarrassed, and fired! 🤬🤬🤬

title: It workED well.
text:
Another example of “updating” an app and ruining what made it good. It WAS easy to use, bug free, and workEd without fail. This version? Buggy, inconsistent and TERRIBLE UX.

With every update, this app gets worse. NOW ,it makes you sign in with your user name and password EVERY time you use the app. 

Just terrible. Buy the google product, and support a company that knows what it’s doing.

title: Geofencing must be on to use “away” mode
text: You have made a change to the app which requires geofencing to be “on” for me to use the “away” mode. This is unacceptable.
