The thermostat is in a vacation home 200 miles away and I don’t want to use geofencing. Please change this ASAP. You also need to provide good documentation. I never would have discovered this without contacting technical support.

title: But I cannot add the thermostat
text: What in the world does “you have provided incorrect location information “ mean?  I *just* connected to the thermostat private network, then sent it the password of my WiFi but the app says this incorrect location. What?? I am in the wrong location and that’s why I cannot add the thermostat?! Let’s be honest, the device is half useless if I cannot use the app. 1 star?

title: Poorly designed app! Just buy a NEST and don’t waste your time.
text: Every time Lux updates their app, you have to start from scratch just to connect to WiFi. Thermostat is very buggy, displays the date and time in European format. Just buy anything other than a Lux and you’ll be happy you did. I’m sitting here like a sucker trying to reconnect my thermostat to WiFi and it’s just not worth the effort.

title: Worst App for a Thermostat
text: Four years ago, the app worked smoothly with my Geo thermostat. Somewhere along the way they redesigned it for a far less functional experience. Not only is it harder to use, it frequently fails to connect with my thermostat network. It’s unfortunate how badly designed this app has become... I would not recommend purchasing the thermostat on account of this app.

title: Still does not work at all! Bring back old app!
text: The small update the last few days didn’t fix any of the big issues caused when the company overhauled the app in September. I can’t change from cool to heat on the app. That’s pretty important if you want to be able to operate the system remotely. Come on - roll back to the original app that actually worked.

title: Junk
text: The thermostat worked well for a while, but now it won’t connect to anything out of nowhere. Went to the support site and attempted to re setup and can’t delete old thermostat. Now the thermostat is stuck in setup mode and phone refuses to program it. As far as I can tell the thermostat is okay but the app is crap. Lux please add a remove option that is usable. The directions to remove from the Lux website reference menus that do not exist...

title: Big step down
text: I would love to have the old app back.  Simple and reliable, the thermostat doesn’t respond through this new app most of the time.  Don’t think I had one instance where changing setting didn’t work with the old app.  Now it just seems like luck if it responds to this app at all.  Not a positive move with this new app, please make the old app available.

title: Why did they redesign?
text: I waited a few weeks to get used to the new app before reviewing, but now I can say confidently this is one of the worst app redesigns I’ve seen in a while. The old app did exactly what I needed it to. Now every change I make takes twice as long. Why get rid of sliders and replace them with manual boxes? The interface isn’t intuitive at all. I hope they revert back.

title: I want the old app back
text:
New app is awful.  Buggy, loses connection with thermostat, can’t swipe down and force app to refresh settings thermostat.  

Old app was intuitive and simple; had it up and running in less than 15 min. Took days to get new app set correctly.  

Today app lost contact with thermostat while I was out.  Had to unplug thermostat 2x to get the connection back.  To add insult to injury, app said on one page it was connected to thermostat, but on another it said it wasn’t.  And it truly wasn’t.  

Have no idea what status icon means - no explanation and the colors within it do not correspond with current HVAC status.  

Extremely frustrating.

title: I Like It.
text: I did the permanent power installation so the display would be lit 24/7. Makes for a nice night light in the hallway. Would like their engineers to design a better antenna system for connecting to Wi-Fi. That’s the only weakness I have discovered so far.

title: A step backwards
text: The latest version overhauled the UI and it is a big step back. Prior version was very intuitive and had clean graphics. Now it’s a mess of hidden/sliding menus. One of the nicest features before was the colorful slider bar for setting the daily temp schedule—now replaced by clunky settings requiring more tapping.

title: Still a mess
text: Despite update still losing signals and will not reconnect.  This is especially notable with second thermostat.  Also there’s power management issues.  Drained new lithium’s in less than 30 days.  Once responsive email customer service radio silent.  Disappointing a company backed by Johnson Controls could not execute a functional app update.  Leadership team should be embarrassed

title: App does not work
text:
I bought a new Lux Geo thermostat.  Installation went fine until it was time to connect to the internet using this app.  It did not work at all.  The app kept getting stuck at the step to connect to thermostat.  The online tutorials and instructions provided by Lux show a completely different GUI from the app I was using.

title: Schedule

title: Updated review for updated app

title: Horrible Update

title: The old app was so much better
text: Please bring the old app back! It was intuitive and easy to use. The new one is awful. I don’t use it often and spend so much time trying to figure out where everything is. The symbols/controls aren’t intuitive and I now have to click through multiple pages just to get to the thermostat.

title: Hate the new app

Everything you want to do is hidden and you have to swipe around the screen to find what you are looking for. 

Bring back the old app please.

title: Bring back the old app. This is useless.

If they don’t fix this I will never buy a Lux thermostat again and may need to swap out the ones I already have for another brand.

title: Disconnect!!!!

title: Love the ability to control my shop temperature

I come home to a freezing house and need to restart the entire system. This app has rendered an expensive thermostat completely useless. Don’t waste your money.

PLEASE make the old, functioning app available!  If you can’t properly test your apps, at least give us a functional option!

title: Terrible new app

title: Terrible app

title: Update broke ability to change temperature
text:
On the iPhone 12 Pro Max the app sees my upstairs GEO. However in the app the new silly temperature control needle swings left and right, but the temp won’t change. Completely broken. So I can look at the heat usage statistics, but I can’t actually control the thermostat.

My downstairs GEO can’t connect through WiFi at all since the update, so it’s now a dumb thermostat.

Not as dumb as this app, though.

And to add the cherry on top, Lux keeps sending me email after email that my filter needs changing. They have no idea what kind of furnace I’m using or what the filter schedule actually is, but the emails keep coming and there is no way to tell them to stop. No unsubscribe, no feedback link. 

Time to research new thermostats.

Update: I just received two new Sensi Touch thermostats and two 24v plug in power adapters  which I discovered can easily be used to power the Sensis without a C wire.

They arrived just in time. My upstairs GEO is doing that thing again where I wake up cold because it thinks the room temp is six degrees hotter than it actually is, and I have to raise the temp to 76 degrees until it randomly fixes itself, after which I have to turn it down again after coming home to an overheated house. The online scuttlebutt is that the wifi circuitry is too close to the temp sensor; it heats up when there is heavy wifi activity or problems connecting, and the sensor thinks the room is warmer than it is. When it finally finishes whatever it was trying to do, it cools down again and your house overheats. I put up with that more than a dozen times over the last three years. But this latest travesty of an app update and the barrage of unstoppable emails was the last straw.

Goodbye, Lux.

Last update: removed the GEO and installed the Sensi Touch with a cheap plug-in 24 volt wall adapter. It worked immediately and connected to wifi and the iPhone app with zero issues. Up and fully running in about five minutes. Lux went in the trash. Downstairs GEO will be replaced tomorrow. 

For those who have two wire systems, on the Sensi cut the RH/RC jumper loop, connect white to W/E, red to RH, and the two wires from the transformer to RC and C.  (Doesn’t matter which goes to which). The jumper to cut is a little loop of bare silver wire sticking out on the right of the terminals. It’s labeled. Easy peasy.

text:

The troubleshooting instructions on the Lux website are useless. They tell you to take actions that are not even doable. For example, it tells you to simply toggle between cool and heat. But our heat won’t come on because the thermostat isn’t recognizing it. And when we saw Error code 5, the online manual shows every code BUT 5. And even with the codes shown, it defines the problem but gives no link to a solution. 

Now they’ve released a new “updated” app and it’s worse than ever. I work full time and their customer service is only open during normal business hours, so forget getting help evenings and weekends, when I actually have time to mess with it for hours. And when I finally called during business hours, they’re “experiencing long wait times and are aware of problems with our new app.”  NO KIDDING! Lux needs to invest in some tech and developers who have a clue. If you’re a potential buyer, wait until their reviews improve, or brace yourself for ongoing frustration.
